trans-unit.source: Title: Build your GitHub-hosted projects in Visual Studio Online ms.TocTitle: In GitHub ms.ContentId: 03C7B380-4767-42E4-B99E-37911F70CAB5
trans-unit.target: Title: Build your GitHub-hosted projects in Visual Studio Online ms.TocTitle: In GitHub ms.ContentId: 03C7B380-4767-42E4-B99E-37911F70CAB5

trans-unit.source: Build your GitHub-hosted projects in Visual Studio Online
trans-unit.target: Build your GitHub-hosted projects in Visual Studio Online

trans-unit.source: Before you start
trans-unit.target: Before you start

trans-unit.source: If you don't have a Visual Studio Online account, <linkText>create one</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have a Visual Studio Online account, <linkText>create one</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have a build agent, set up a <linkText>Windows agent</linkText><title></title> or an <linkText>Xplat agent</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have a build agent, set up a <linkText>Windows agent</linkText><title></title> or an <linkText>Xplat agent</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have permission GitHub to read the repository and in your team project on Visual Studio Online to create a build definition.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have permission GitHub to read the repository and in your team project on Visual Studio Online to create a build definition.

trans-unit.source: (If you just created an account, you do have this permission.)
trans-unit.target: (If you just created an account, you do have this permission.)

trans-unit.source: If you're going to set up continuous integration build, you need to administrator permissions in both the GitHub repo and the Visual Studio Online team project.
trans-unit.target: If you're going to set up continuous integration build, you need to administrator permissions in both the GitHub repo and the Visual Studio Online team project.

trans-unit.source: Create a build definition
trans-unit.target: Create a build definition

trans-unit.source: In GitHub, <linkText>create an access token</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: In GitHub, <linkText>create an access token</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use the repo, user, admin:repo_hook scopes so that Visual Studio Online can discover private and public repositories that you have access to, create a web hook in GitHub (which is what queues the build in Visual Studio Online), and fetch the contents of the repository during the build.
trans-unit.target: Use the repo, user, admin:repo_hook scopes so that Visual Studio Online can discover private and public repositories that you have access to, create a web hook in GitHub (which is what queues the build in Visual Studio Online), and fetch the contents of the repository during the build.

trans-unit.source: In your team project in Visual Studio Online, go to the Build explorer page and add a build definition.
trans-unit.target: In your team project in Visual Studio Online, go to the Build explorer page and add a build definition.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add a build definition</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add a build definition</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the repository tab, fill out your GitHub repository information, and provide the access token you just created.
trans-unit.target: On the repository tab, fill out your GitHub repository information, and provide the access token you just created.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>GitHub repository build settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>GitHub repository build settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Depending on the template you used, you might need to confugure some settings in the Build or Options tab, too.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the template you used, you might need to confugure some settings in the Build or Options tab, too.

trans-unit.source: If you want to set up a CI build, do that on the triggers tab.
trans-unit.target: If you want to set up a CI build, do that on the triggers tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Continuous integration trigger</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Continuous integration trigger</linkText>

trans-unit.source: That will set up a web hook in the GitHub repository to let Visual Studio Online know to queue a build.
trans-unit.target: That will set up a web hook in the GitHub repository to let Visual Studio Online know to queue a build.

trans-unit.source: If there's an error, you might not have permission in the GitHub repository to set up web hooks.
trans-unit.target: If there's an error, you might not have permission in the GitHub repository to set up web hooks.

trans-unit.source: If that's the case, just turn off the CI trigger and you can still queue your builds manually or on a schedule.
trans-unit.target: If that's the case, just turn off the CI trigger and you can still queue your builds manually or on a schedule.

trans-unit.source: Test your CI build
trans-unit.target: Test your CI build

trans-unit.source: From the Build.Preview explorer page, look at the queued builds for your build definition.
trans-unit.target: From the Build.Preview explorer page, look at the queued builds for your build definition.

trans-unit.source: (It's probably empty right now).
trans-unit.target: (It's probably empty right now).

trans-unit.source: Push a change to the GitHub repository.
trans-unit.target: Push a change to the GitHub repository.

trans-unit.source: Switch back to Visual Studio Online and wait for a queued build to appear.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: Switch back to Visual Studio Online and wait for a queued build to appear.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: In the build summary, there's a link to the GitHub commit that triggerd the build.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: In the build summary, there's a link to the GitHub commit that triggerd the build.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: Click this link to open a new browser window with a summary of the changes in the commit in GitHub.<html></html>
trans-unit.target: Click this link to open a new browser window with a summary of the changes in the commit in GitHub.<html></html>

trans-unit.source: Q & A
trans-unit.target: Q & A

trans-unit.source: Q: Will CI builds be triggered for a pull request?
trans-unit.target: Q: Will CI builds be triggered for a pull request?

trans-unit.source: A: No.
trans-unit.target: A: No.

trans-unit.source: Builds can only be queued when code is pushed to the repository, not on pull requests.
trans-unit.target: Builds can only be queued when code is pushed to the repository, not on pull requests.

trans-unit.source: We're evaluating how best to implement this feature.
trans-unit.target: We're evaluating how best to implement this feature.
